alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 9:41PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MULTIPLE HEAVY RAIN EVENTS TO ARRIVE FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... Multiple weather fronts are expected to move into the Southeast Alaska forecast area from Friday to Wednesday. The Northeast Gulf will already be saturated with rains from midweek, and lighter rains spreading into the panhandle Thursday will begin to prime the remainder of the panhandle region. Long range ensembles are still showing a little variety in rainfall totals, however, they are fairly confident that the totals will range between 2 and 6 inches. The main differences are in the timing of rain and potential for maximum totals. The primed or saturated soils will result in much of the rain ending up as run off into the streams and rivers. At the present, we expect multiple streams and rivers to increase rapidly towards bankfull levels this weekend and into early next week. Anyone working, living, or recreating on the streams should be be prepared for higher water and the potential for flooding to develop.
